page.title: 19RELIGIONS
page.content: There are three religions represented in the village, Church of England, Methodist and Baptist. They each have their own church and services and all are well attended by a loyal group. The Methodists have a service every Sunday afternoon plus monthly family services and childrens' Sunday school each week. There is a harvest thanksgiving and a Spring Flower Festival as well as special Christmas services. The Womens' Fellowship run fortnightly meetings. The Baptists have two services each Sunday and run a Sunday school. They support Baptist missionaries and the Tear Fund (The Evangelical Alliance Relief) both of whom work in the Third World. Church members visit any one in need in the parish. The Baptists unite with the Anglican and Methodists for Radio Norfolk Bible Study Courses.
